intro: Blitum crassifolium, commonly known as broadleaf blite, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features basal leaves that are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Blitum crassifolium is often found in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in mountainous regions.
